reviews.review_msg: Assignments are engaging, but lectures can be disorganized. Bobby is helpful when asked questions. Unstuck ai was a lifesaver for exam prep. Overall, a solid course if you put in the work.

Assignments will make you learn a lot and encourage searching finding answers online or through other sources. Bobby is very nice and gives great feedback and is very helpful when asked questions. Exams are usually slide & assignment based, very manageable if your review lectures or do good on assignments

Great professor. He taught everything slowly and understandably in a very rigorous manner. The assignments were fun and not too serious, and he was very responsive to emails and questions. He does not speed through the course; rather, he stops at every part to make sure everyone understands. Amazing professor, strongly recommend.

Bobby does mostly demos in class and posts them to GitHub which I liked. He is passionate about web dev which kept lectures engaging and is always available for Q's. This course had a LOT of material and was quite overwhelming at times but I learned a lot! Def not a GPA booster course but would recommend if ur interested in web dev.

Awful at explaining topics. His lecture notes are tested on yet he does not cover them in class which makes no sense. He instead does demo's and hardly explains what hes coding since he is just looking at another monitor with the code hes gonna write. He seems nice but SFU needs another prof teaching the course.

His lecture notes are incomplete and he doesnt even go over them in class. He expects students to go over his lecture notes on their own time which is impossible since his lecture notes aren't complete. He goes over demos in class and he himself doesnt know whats going on and student help him debug his code. His lecturing abilities are poor.

Assignments are quite enjoyable and force you to teach yourself, but his lectures are not great. Lecture slides are disorganized and unhelpful, and the prof rushes through topics without really teaching them. Be ready, anything, even those that he barely explained, are a fair game on the exam. Exam seems to test pretty insignificant or minor info.

Bobby has great lectures, responds fast to emails, assignments were really fun to do. However, the only downside is his tests are multiple choice memorization of little facts in his powerpoints and lectures which is kind of unfair. I got like 67% on the final and still got an A though so it was ok. Overall very very good.

Clear lectures, difficult but practical and fair assignments, good lectures. Exams are on hard side, beware of MC. Really good course for web dev. Bobby is always smiling and approachable, friendly guy. Final was a lot easier than the MT imo. Would take bobby again!
BADDDDD  PROFFFFFFF

His lectures were pretty informative and useful. I learnt a lot about html/css/js/react. Very unclear grading criterias for assignments and tests. The assignments were overly tedious (remake a healthcare form in html without css) and tests were way to long for the time given. You really need to be able to code fast to do good in this class.

This was Shervin's first time teaching the class, and it showed in the lack of organization. Too much time was spent on HTML/CSS, leaving only 2 weeks for JavaScript/React. Assignments were okay, but exams were impossible to finish on time. He asked for a long HTML form with unclear instructions, which he hadn't even completed himself.

Shervin's alright himself, but I think if he teaches this again he should reconsider his testing strategy, and put some more thought into the questions he asks. Unacceptable for such a "distinguised prof", I mean take a look at this guys personal website... you kidding me ???

Lectures was audio recorded, quizzes on canvas. The quizzes could be time constraining at times. Homework was not of the best quality (eg. creating forms with html). Project was not difficult, you could do it on your own in 2-3 days. The midterm and final was bad, basically a homework assignment for each question. TA's marked generously on these.

Shervin, in his own words, "decided [he] could take teach this course, as how hard can web dev be?" I think he was very underprepared to teach this course, as he often struggled to see errors in his code. Course content was unbalanced; one of the assignments was just copy and paste for 3h.  As a lecturer he's a bit dry but ok, so I'll see for 371.

I get that web dev is not his area, but wow, Shervin's version of this course is a waste of money. He spends way too much time on the extremely easy basics and only does 2 weeks of actual frontend frameworks. Assignments are random and useless and he crams an impossible amount of questions into the exams. Take with Bobby or just do W3C tutorials.

The lectures were kinda dry, and the slides were minimal. Assignment instructions were vague (and the solutions sucks). Exams (midterm, final, quizzes) were very tight on time. If you know the material well, you wouldn't get a bad grade. Otherwise, be prepared to retake because he does this Midterm + Final weighted average thingy
Never wrote a rmp review til this guy, learned nothing throughout the class and prof refused to dispute any final exam remarkings. Just watch a web dev tutorial instead of taking this class with him.

Bad lecturer and very badly timed tests. Questions on midterm and final were assignment level. Assignments were fine, quizzes are medium level, you need 50% average between midterm and final to pass, which is not optimal for a web dev course so even if you did well on everything, if you do slightly bad on the final, you fail. Never take with him.

Final was not what it was described as on canvas/lecture and was incredibly difficult to do time wise since questions were nearly on the level of some assignments. Since a 50% is needed on the combined midterm and final to pass there were people who did well on assignments, quizzes and projects but still unfairly failed due to the bad final exam.

Good luck to those doing his exams.
In person but on canvas... fail if you dont average 50%

Shervin isn't the worst professor I've had, but passing his class comes entirely down to how well you can perform on exams. If you are somebody who needs a little extra time when you code you will fail his exams. I had a very good assignment, quiz, and project average but failed due to the final because I could not finish in the timeframe.

He is absolutely not a bad prof, for 371, he is one of the best and chillest. 272 isn't his forte so he didn't gauge correctly the exam final load so it ends up being a mess, this is his first time teaching web dev after all. 

In case u do take 272 with him, just watch crash course and his final should be a litteral accumulative of his assignment.

He does not deserve this rating..hard final does not mean the bad teaching. It was not even that hard, average is over 65. If you could do all the assignments without using AI, final was doable. Don't blame prof for not putting enough effort. We are all here to learn something, not to ask for high grade.

Prof. Shirmohammadi is not a great lecturer, and has very time-constraining tests. His final exam included making a very long form in only html, which ultimately was too time consuming to finish along with the other tasks of making some small webapps. If you can, take the class with someone else.

Avoid if you can. Assignments and lectures are actually OK, but quizzes, and especially exams, are atrocious. Bro expects us to complete 4 long coding questions in 2.5 hours, each of them almost a full assignment in length. Given that exams are worth over 50% and are required to pass, do not take if you want to save your GPA.

Not the best prof for web development, I'm not sure why he opted to teach this course when he's new to the topic himself. Assignments are redundant, often makes you complete trivial things like building a long html table form. His assignment criteria and requirements also changes but he won't inform you. The final was filled with long tough q's.

I am currently writing this review bald. As I sat through the final exam, it felt like my hair was slowly disappearing, one strand at a time. He somehow managed to forget to install NodeJS in class and was watching an Intro to React tutorial on YouTube instead. University of Ottawa, please reconsider taking him back...

Just plain awful. If you are planning to take this course with Shervin, get ready for a stressful semester. Assignments and quizzes are easy. But the exams are absolutely brutal and disorganized. They don't test your critical thinking skills, instead you have to copy paste text from a form for half the exam. Avoid at all costs!

He's not as bad as people say. Not great, not bad. the worst part was that there was barely enough time to complete exams, so you're always on the edge of your toes. Other than that, shervy is not bad.
Ill be honest, it's a great course! I didnt attend most classes as the slides and recorded lecture audio was great. Quizes are easy
This dude just yaps I swear, I think he knows web dev but dude does not care at all. He wants that sweet tenure.

Only reason I did well was because I already learned everything, literally learned nothing throughout the entire class. Half the time he's struggling to use visual studio code, like your a computer science professor???

The professor's lack of preparation during lectures and the vague assignment instructions only added to the frustration. The final exam was especially brutal, requiring us to write a super long HTML form, which was unreasonable and left most classmates unable to finish.
This professor was so hard, he doesn't teach web dev at all and is super lazy. Take with a different teacher, he literally does nothing and makes impossible tests.

I had a very challenging experience with this professor. The midterm and final exams were filled with exceptionally tedious assignment questions, making them nearly impossible to complete on time. Assignments and group projects were boring and didn't contribute meaningfully to learning.

No doubt this man is very smart, however he is not a very good teacher for web dev. If you are experienced in web dev you can get by, otherwise his exams will put you in the dirt. best to take this class with a different teacher
Exams were not fair in the amount of work to do and the time given. He needs to be trialed for the crime against student mental health. -100 aura to all Mohammads
Just watch a tutorial on YouTube.

Midterm and final were absolutely horrible, questions were exceptionally drawn out and tedious making them near impossible to complete on time. The assignments and group project were pretty boring. Just avoid the course with Shervin. Overall killed much of my enjoyment of web development.

I had a very challenging experience with this professor. The exams were filled with tedious assignment questions, which weren't particularly difficult but were extremely time-consuming, leaving most students unable to finish. The assignments felt unnecessarily drawn out and didn't contribute meaningfully to our learning.

The exams for this course are heavily focused on brain rot coding questions, and while documentation is provided, it's not enough to make up for the challenging nature of the tests. I would recommend considering other options, or just not doing the course- didn't learn much at all.
Horrible teacher, exams are pure coding questions granted we get documentation to look at. DO NOT TAKE
FInal Exam was totally unfair...
This guys exams are so stupid. He puts tedious assignment questions on the midterm and final that aren't even hard, but they take forever to do so no one is finishing. Tedious and useless assignments

I've never given a RMP rating since this guy. Avoid at all costs, the midterm + final are impossible to finish. One question on the finally needed minimum 300 lines of code. Makes tedious questions and just not a good prof overall. When asked how to contact your group he said there has to be some way to (pretty much figure it out yourself).

What the hell was that final? Just came out, everybody who wrote it agreed that it was super unfair. 4 massive written questions, absolutely no mercy from Shervin that was brutal. If you love HTML forms, that was for you. Else, if you hate tedious tasks- AVOID.
That final was so brutal, making us write a super long HTML form for no reason. It was unreasonable; most classmates couldn't complete it on time.

This dude gave us such a hard final and made us recreate dumb forms with HTML that required 700 lines of code. AVOID, PLEASE; He was so hard for this course that it is not supposed to be hard. During lecture, he is also never prepared.

His assignments are so hard and his tests, I used to love doing web development but he has actively made me hate doing web development. Even if your interested in web development, I beg you: please don't take!

Terrible professor/class, midterm was very hard, as barely anybody even finished the midterm and was unrealistic. Assignments are also terrible, with vague instructions and you learn nothing at all in lectures- have to learn everything on your own. AVOID!! Professor has no clue what he's doing!!

Extremely vague assignment instructions and bad exams. The test questions themselves are easy enough, but far too little time to complete them, especially the coding questions. Lectures are not that useful, you're better off learning on your own. TAs were helpful and nice though.

The professor talks a lot in lectures, goes over the material properly. So the assignments and quizzes are not hard, but be prepared to spent a hours writing the repetitive stuff and learning nothing new. The midterm was not hard but there was no way anyone could have finished on time.

The midterm was awful and terrible, gave 45 minutes to do 5 mcq and 2 long written questions. Alone, the 2 written questions would've taken like 30-40 minutes. Lectures are also terrible, doesn't really explain anything and his slides really aren't related to tests. Avoid at all cost, he will tank your grade.

Assignments are the most boring and unhelpful I've done in any course. They aren't hard they're just a bunch of copying an pasting, nothing to learn, no interesting challenges, just write some html and css and copy and paste for 5 hours. Lectures were fine but other than that terrible experience. Quizzes were also way too short. Avoid if you can.
